Wide Deck Lawn Mower RepairAt Sears Home Services, we specialize in comprehensive repair and maintenance services for wide deck lawn mowers. Our certified technicians are equipped to handle common issues such as vibration problems, blade imbalance, and engine starting difficulties.
Common Wide Deck Mower Issues

Vibration Problems: Often caused by debris in the deck or unbalanced blades.
Blade Imbalance: Can lead to uneven cuts and increased wear on the mower.
Belt and Pulley Wear: Worn belts can affect the mower's performance and efficiency.
Engine Starting Issues: May result from spark plug problems or fuel system blockages.

Our Repair Process:

Initial Inspection: Thorough examination of the mower to identify issues.
Diagnosis and Cost Estimate: Transparent pricing provided before any work begins.
Repair and Testing: Repairs conducted using quality parts, followed by performance testing.
Final Quality Check: Ensuring the mower operates at optimal performance.

Wide Deck Mower Maintenance Tips:

Regular Cleaning: Prevent buildup of grass and debris.
Blade Sharpening: Sharpen blades after every 25 hours of use.
Engine Oil Replacement: Change oil every season or after 50 hours of use.
Proper Storage: Store in a dry, sheltered area to prevent rust and corrosion

Wide Deck Mower Brands We Service:
Our technicians are experienced in servicing a variety of brands:

Craftsman
Husqvarna
MTD
Ariens
Cub Cadet
Murray
Snapper
Poulan
Yard Machines

No matter where you bought your wide deck lawn mower, Sears can fix it.
Why Choose Sears Home Services for Wide Deck Lawn Mower Repair?

Sears Home Services is the number one leader of wide deck lawn mower repair service in the country. Our service technicians have been trusted for generations to service the repair needs of the communities in which they live.
If your wide mower deck won’t raise or lower, if the deck is uneven, or if the mower won’t start, you want quick and reliable repair. Sears service technicians are near you and offer same-day or next-day service in many areas, so you can count on us to fix your mower fast.
Sears uses OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) parts to fix your wide deck lawn mower. OEM parts fit properly and last longer than after-market parts.

full_content.content:
Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat should I do if my wide deck lawn mower is vibrating excessively?Excessive vibration in your wide deck lawn mower could be caused by several issues. First, check for debris caught inside the mower deck or pulley, as this can cause vibration. It could also be due to an unbalanced blade, in which case rebalancing the blades might help.
If the issue persists, inspect the belt, pulley, and mandrel for damage. Additionally, loose bolts or nuts on the mower deck could cause vibration, so tightening them might resolve the problem.
If these solutions don’t work, there may be an issue with the blade drive system.Why is my wide deck lawn mower not cutting grass evenly?Uneven cutting in your mower can be caused by a few different factors. First, check the tire inflation on your mower; uneven tire pressure can lead to uneven cuts. Also, ensure that the mower deck is leveled correctly. If you notice alternating stripes of taller and shorter grass, it may be due to mowing too quickly—try slowing down. Worn or dull blades can also cause uneven cuts, so consider sharpening or replacing the blades for a cleaner cut.Can I repair my wide deck lawn mower myself?Some wide deck lawn mower issues can be addressed by homeowners. Check the owner's manual to find common maintenance procedures and part replacements that you can do on your own.
For major repairs beyond your DIY capabilities, Sears Home Services offers professional repair services by trained technicians for a quick and reliable solution.What brands of wide deck lawn mowers does Sears repair?Sears Home Services is equipped to repair a variety of wide deck lawn mower brands. They service many well-known brands including Craftsman, Husqvarna, MTD, Ariens, Cub Cadet, Murray, Snapper, Poulan, and Yard Machines. No matter where you bought your mower, Sears can help fix it quickly using OEM parts for long-lasting results.Sears Home Services – Service You Can Trust
If these DIY tips don’t help, or if you’re having other problems with your wide deck lawn mower, Sears Home Services is here to help.
Our repair technicians are experts in their field, with an average of 10 years of experience and extensive training and knowledge. They’ll inspect your wide deck lawn mower to diagnose and fix it quickly.
Schedule your wide deck mower repair today!
Schedule Professional Maintenance
Sears service also provides professional wide deck mower maintenance for your machine. Regular maintenance ensures your mower stays in tip-top shape. Along with testing for overall operation, the technician will perform the following services:

Inspect the air filter
Inspect the fuel filter
Inspect the carburetor
Inspect all belts
Lubricate moving parts

Schedule your wide deck mower tune-up today.

What should I do if my wide deck lawn mower is vibrating excessively?Excessive vibration in your wide deck lawn mower could be caused by several issues. First, check for debris caught inside the mower deck or pulley, as this can cause vibration. It could also be due to an unbalanced blade, in which case rebalancing the blades might help.
If the issue persists, inspect the belt, pulley, and mandrel for damage. Additionally, loose bolts or nuts on the mower deck could cause vibration, so tightening them might resolve the problem.
If these solutions don’t work, there may be an issue with the blade drive system.Why is my wide deck lawn mower not cutting grass evenly?Uneven cutting in your mower can be caused by a few different factors. First, check the tire inflation on your mower; uneven tire pressure can lead to uneven cuts. Also, ensure that the mower deck is leveled correctly. If you notice alternating stripes of taller and shorter grass, it may be due to mowing too quickly—try slowing down. Worn or dull blades can also cause uneven cuts, so consider sharpening or replacing the blades for a cleaner cut.Can I repair my wide deck lawn mower myself?Some wide deck lawn mower issues can be addressed by homeowners. Check the owner's manual to find common maintenance procedures and part replacements that you can do on your own.
For major repairs beyond your DIY capabilities, Sears Home Services offers professional repair services by trained technicians for a quick and reliable solution.What brands of wide deck lawn mowers does Sears repair?Sears Home Services is equipped to repair a variety of wide deck lawn mower brands. They service many well-known brands including Craftsman, Husqvarna, MTD, Ariens, Cub Cadet, Murray, Snapper, Poulan, and Yard Machines. No matter where you bought your mower, Sears can help fix it quickly using OEM parts for long-lasting results.

full_content.content: Why is my wide deck lawn mower not cutting grass evenly?Uneven cutting in your mower can be caused by a few different factors. First, check the tire inflation on your mower; uneven tire pressure can lead to uneven cuts. Also, ensure that the mower deck is leveled correctly. If you notice alternating stripes of taller and shorter grass, it may be due to mowing too quickly—try slowing down. Worn or dull blades can also cause uneven cuts, so consider sharpening or replacing the blades for a cleaner cut.

Couldn't have been more pleasedWhat I believed to be simply a "diagnostic" call to determine the cause of the noise and non-movement problem with my Cub Cadet riding mower, but it turned into on the spot repair. The culprit was the long,  underneath belt drive for the mower unit. What a relief, because riding lawn repair shops are few and far to be found--and you'll be lucky if you can find one that won't put you on a weeks long for pickup. Highly recommended.Charles H, Renton, WADecember 05, 2025

Glossary TermsWhat is the drum of the washing machine?The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.What is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.
